intro: Coleobotrys rubra, commonly known as the red-flowered rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its bright red flowers bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Coleobotrys rubra is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
